alert.note: Alert for Carter (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 11 at 8:28PM MDT until July 11 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MDT FOR EAST CENTRAL CARTER COUNTY... At 827 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 12 miles northwest of Camp Crook, or 24 miles southeast of Ekalaka, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail, along with heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Carter County, east of Belltower. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
